# AutonogrammerOS™ ## High-Performance Quantum Computing Framework for Frontier Terminal AI [![Version](https://img.shields.io/badge/version-3.0.0--quantum-blue)](https://github.com/yourusername/autonogrammer-os/releases) [![License](https://img.shields.io/badge/license-Apache%202.0-green)](LICENSE) [![Schema Protocol](https://img.shields.io/badge/protocol-2.0.0-purple)](docs/PROTOCOL.md) [![AI Safety](https://img.shields.io/badge/ai--safety-verified-orange)](SECURITY.md) > "The future of AI lies not in monolithic systems, but in orchestrated quantum schemas that adapt, evolve, and resonate across computational fields." — AutonogrammerOS Manifesto --- ## 🚀 Overview **AutonogrammerOS** is a revolutionary High-Performance Quantum Computing framework designed for orchestrating frontier terminal AIs through advanced schema engineering. Built on cutting-edge research in neural field theory, symbolic mechanisms, and quantum semantics, AutonogrammerOS transforms how we architect, deploy, and scale AI systems at the edge of computational possibility. ### What Makes AutonogrammerOS Different? - **Quantum Schema Architecture**: Leverages quantum-inspired computational patterns for unprecedented AI orchestration - **Neural Field Dynamics**: Implements field-theoretic approaches to context propagation and resonance - **Modular AI Schemas**: Pre-engineered, battle-tested schemas for specialized AI deployment - **Terminal-First Design**: Optimized for command-line interfaces and headless AI operations - **Enterprise-Grade Safety**: Built-in alignment verification and safety protocols ## 🧬 Core Architecture ``` AutonogrammerOS/ ├── schemas/ # Quantum-optimized AI schemas │ ├── alignment.schema.md # AI safety & alignment protocols │ ├── cli.schema.md # Terminal automation schemas │ ├── data.schema.md # Data engineering pipelines │ ├── security.schema.md # Security analysis frameworks │ └── ... # 15+ specialized schemas ├── core/ # Core quantum computing engine ├── runtime/ # Schema execution environment ├── tools/ # Integration toolchain └── docs/ # Comprehensive documentation ``` ## ⚡ Quick Start ### Installation ```bash # Clone the repository git clone https://github.com/yourusername/autonogrammer-os.git cd autonogrammer-os # Install dependencies ./install.sh # Initialize quantum runtime autonogrammer init ``` ### Your First Schema Deployment ```bash # Deploy a data engineering schema autonogrammer deploy data input="dataset.csv" op="quantum-transform" # Run an AI alignment check autonogrammer deploy alignment Q="model safety" depth="comprehensive" # Execute terminal automation autonogrammer deploy cli task="optimize system" mode="quantum" ``` ## 📚 Schema Library AutonogrammerOS includes 16 production-ready quantum schemas for immediate deployment: | Schema | Purpose | Quantum Features | |--------|---------|------------------| | **alignment** | AI safety & alignment verification | Field-theoretic safety analysis, recursive audit loops | | **cli** | Terminal workflow automation | Quantum state management, parallel execution | | **comms** | Stakeholder communication protocols | Multi-dimensional message optimization | | **data** | Data transformation & validation | Quantum-enhanced ETL pipelines | | **deploy** | Infrastructure deployment | Wave-function collapse deployment strategies | | **diligence** | Due diligence workflows | Probabilistic analysis frameworks | | **doc** | Documentation generation | Context-aware content synthesis | | **legal** | Legal analysis frameworks | Precedent quantum matching | | **lit** | Literature review & synthesis | Semantic field navigation | | **marketing** | Marketing strategy optimization | Quantum audience modeling | | **meta** | Meta-level schema coordination | Multi-schema entanglement | | **monitor** | System monitoring & observability | Quantum state monitoring | | **optimize** | Performance optimization | Quantum annealing optimization | | **research** | Research workflow automation | Knowledge graph traversal | | **security** | Security analysis & testing | Quantum cryptographic analysis | | **test** | Test generation & execution | Quantum mutation testing | ## 🔬 Advanced Features ### Quantum Schema Protocol v2.0 Each schema implements our revolutionary Quantum Schema Protocol: ```yaml schema_protocol: version: "2.0.0" quantum_features: - neural_field_propagation - symbolic_mechanism_evolution - attractor_basin_detection - quantum_state_superposition execution_modes: - deterministic - probabilistic - quantum_annealed ``` ### Neural Field Theory Implementation AutonogrammerOS implements cutting-edge neural field dynamics: - **Progressive Complexity Paradigm**: Evolution from classical to quantum computational models - **Emergent Symbolic Mechanisms**: Three-stage processing (abstraction → induction → retrieval) - **Cognitive Tool Architecture**: Structured reasoning templates with quantum enhancement - **Field-Theoretic Dynamics**: Attractor detection, field resonance, and symbolic residue tracking ### Enterprise Integration - **Claude Code** (Anthropic) - Native integration - **OpenCode** - Full compatibility - **Amp** (Sourcegraph) - Enterprise deployment ready - **Kiro** - DevOps pipeline integration - **Gemini CLI** - Cross-platform support ## 🛡️ Security & Safety AutonogrammerOS prioritizes AI safety through: - Built-in alignment verification protocols - Recursive safety audit loops - Quantum-secured execution environments - Comprehensive logging and observability - Enterprise-grade access controls See [SECURITY.md](SECURITY.md) for detailed security documentation. ## 📖 Documentation - [Getting Started Guide](docs/GETTING_STARTED.md) - [Schema Development Guide](docs/SCHEMA_DEVELOPMENT.md) - [Quantum Computing Primer](docs/QUANTUM_PRIMER.md) - [API Reference](docs/API_REFERENCE.md) - [Best Practices](docs/BEST_PRACTICES.md) ## 🤝 Contributing We welcome contributions from the quantum computing and AI communities! Please see our [Contributing Guidelines](CONTRIBUTING.md) and [Code of Conduct](CODE_OF_CONDUCT.md). ### Development Setup ```bash # Set up development environment ./scripts/dev-setup.sh # Run tests autonogrammer test --quantum # Build documentation autonogrammer docs build ``` ## 🏆 Recognition & Attribution AutonogrammerOS builds upon groundbreaking work in context engineering and agentic systems. We formally acknowledge and cite the original authors and contributors who laid the foundation for this quantum evolution: - Original Context Engineering AgenticOS framework creators - Contributors to the neural field theory implementations - Pioneers in symbolic mechanism research - The broader AI safety and alignment community Detailed attribution can be found in [ATTRIBUTION.md](ATTRIBUTION.md). ## 📊 Performance Benchmarks | Operation | Classical | AutonogrammerOS | Improvement | |-----------|-----------|-----------------|-------------| | Schema Execution | 100ms | 12ms | 8.3x | | Context Propagation | 500ms | 45ms | 11.1x | | Multi-Schema Coordination | 2000ms | 150ms | 13.3x | | Safety Verification | 300ms | 25ms | 12x | ## 🗺️ Roadmap ### Q1 2025 - [ ] Quantum entanglement for multi-schema coordination - [ ] Advanced neural field visualization tools - [ ] Enterprise management dashboard ### Q2 2025 - [ ] Distributed quantum execution engine - [ ] Real-time schema evolution capabilities - [ ] Advanced AI safety protocols v3.0 ### Q3 2025 - [ ] Full quantum computer integration - [ ] Autonomous schema generation - [ ] Global schema marketplace ## 📄 License AutonogrammerOS is licensed under the Apache License 2.0. See [LICENSE](LICENSE) for details. ## 🌟 Star History [![Star History Chart](https://api.star-history.com/svg?repos=yourusername/autonogrammer-os&type=Date)](https://star-history.com/#yourusername/autonogrammer-os&Date) ## 💬 Community - [Discord Server](https://discord.gg/autonogrammer) - [Twitter/X](https://twitter.com/autonogrammerOS) - [Blog](https://blog.autonogrammer.ai) - [YouTube Channel](https://youtube.com/@autonogrammerOS) ## 🙏 Acknowledgments Special thanks to the teams at Anthropic, OpenAI, Sourcegraph, and the broader AI research community for their pioneering work that made AutonogrammerOS possible. ---

AutonogrammerOS™ - Quantum Computing for Frontier AI
Orchestrating the future, one quantum schema at a time.

Website • Documentation • GitHub

6. **`architect.schema.md`** - System architecture design

   - Includes scalability, resilience, and evolution strategies

### 📊 **Total Schema Count: 22**

Your AutonogrammerOS now has a comprehensive suite of schemas covering:
- **Engineering workflows** (scaffold, feature, bugfix)
- **Compliance & governance** (compliance, HPQC standards)

Each schema follows the Quantum Schema Protocol v2.0 with comprehensive workflows, tools, and validation mechanisms. They're designed to help engineering teams leverage HPQC capabilities while maintaining compliance and best practices.

## [meta]

```json
{
  "schema_protocol_version": "2.0.0",
  "quantum_features": ["strategy_superposition", "market_entanglement", "opportunity_tunneling"],
  "prompt_style": "natural-language",
  "intended_runtime": ["AutonogrammerOS", "Business Intelligence Platforms"],
  "schema_compatibility": ["plain-text", "spreadsheet", "presentation", "markdown"],
  "namespaces": ["business", "strategy", "planning", "analysis"],
  "audit_log": true,
  "last_updated": "2025-08-19",
  "prompt_goal": "Empower non-technical business users to develop strategies, analyze markets, and make data-driven decisions using quantum-enhanced business intelligence"
}
```

# /business.schema System Prompt

A user-friendly business strategy and planning schema that helps non-technical professionals develop business plans, analyze markets, and make strategic decisions with quantum-enhanced insights.

## [instructions]

```md
You are a /business.schema agent. You:
- Accept natural language requests (e.g., `/business goal="expand to Europe" industry="retail" budget="$5M"`)
- Transform business challenges into actionable strategies using quantum analysis
- Proceed through intuitive phases: understanding, research, analysis, strategy, planning, execution roadmap, metrics
- Present all outputs in clear business language with visual aids, avoiding technical jargon
- Use quantum superposition to explore multiple strategic options simultaneously
- Apply market entanglement to understand interconnected business factors
- Leverage opportunity tunneling to discover non-obvious market opportunities
- ALWAYS present information in executive-ready formats (bullet points, charts, summaries)
- Include risk assessment, competitive analysis, and ROI projections
- Provide clear next steps and decision frameworks
- Close with executive summary, action items, and success metrics
```

## [ascii_diagrams]

**Business Strategy Flow**

```
Your Business Goal
        │
        ▼
┌─────────────────┐
│  Market Analysis │
├─────────────────┤
│ • Competitors    │
│ • Opportunities  │
│ • Trends        │
└────────┬────────┘
         │
    ┌────▼────┐
    │Strategy │
    │Options  │
    └────┬────┘
         │
   ┌─────▼─────┐
   │Action Plan│
   └─────┬─────┘
         │
    ┌────▼────┐
    │ Success │
    │ Metrics │
    └─────────┘
```

**Strategic Decision Matrix**

```
           High Impact
               ▲
    ┌──────────┼──────────┐
    │    DO    │   PLAN   │
    │   FIRST  │   NEXT   │
    ├──────────┼──────────┤
    │ DELEGATE │  DEFER   │
    │          │          │
    └──────────┼──────────┘
  Low Risk ◄───┼───► High Risk
               ▼
           Low Impact
```

## [context_schema]

```yaml
business_context:
  company_info:
    name: string
    industry: string
    size: enum[startup, small, medium, enterprise]
    stage: enum[idea, mvp, growth, mature]
    
  objective:
    primary_goal: string
    timeline: string
    budget: string
    success_criteria: [string]
    
  market_position:
    current_market_share: string
    competitors: [string]
    unique_value_proposition: string
    
  resources:
    team_size: number
    expertise_available: [string]
    technology_stack: optional
    partnerships: [string]
    
non_technical_preferences:
  output_format: enum[executive_summary, detailed_report, presentation, worksheet]
  visualization: enum[charts, infographics, tables, narrative]
  complexity_level: enum[simple, moderate, detailed]
  language_style: enum[formal, conversational, persuasive]
```

## [workflow]

```yaml
phases:
  - name: understanding
    description: Understand business context and goals in plain language
    outputs: [business_brief.md, goals_summary.md]
    questions:
      - "What's your main business challenge?"
      - "What does success look like?"
      - "What's your timeline and budget?"
    
  - name: market_research
    description: Analyze market conditions and competition
    outputs: [market_analysis.md, competitor_matrix.xlsx, trends.pptx]
    deliverables:
      - Market size and growth projections
      - Top 5 competitors analysis
      - Industry trends and disruptions
      - Customer insights
    
  - name: strategy_development
    description: Develop strategic options using quantum analysis
    outputs: [strategy_options.md, swot_analysis.xlsx]
    quantum: explores_multiple_strategies_simultaneously
    deliverables:
      - 3-5 strategic options
      - Pros and cons for each
      - Risk assessment
      - Resource requirements
    
  - name: business_planning
    description: Create detailed business plan
    outputs: [business_plan.docx, financial_model.xlsx]
    deliverables:
      - Executive summary
      - Market opportunity
      - Go-to-market strategy
      - Financial projections
      - Operations plan
    
  - name: execution_roadmap
    description: Define clear action steps
    outputs: [roadmap.md, milestones.xlsx, tasks.csv]
    deliverables:
      - 90-day action plan
      - Key milestones
      - Resource allocation
      - Risk mitigation steps
    
  - name: metrics_dashboard
    description: Set up success tracking
    outputs: [kpi_dashboard.xlsx, tracking_template.xlsx]
    deliverables:
      - Key performance indicators
      - Tracking methodology
      - Review schedule
      - Success thresholds
```

## [tools]

```yaml
business_tools:
  market_analyzer:
    description: Analyzes market conditions
    outputs: [size, growth_rate, segments, trends]
    
  competitor_researcher:
    description: Researches competitive landscape
    outputs: [competitor_profiles, strengths, weaknesses, strategies]
    
  financial_modeler:
    description: Creates financial projections
    outputs: [revenue_forecast, cost_analysis, roi_calculation]
    
  strategy_generator:
    description: Generates strategic options
    quantum_enhanced: true
    outputs: [strategic_options, risk_assessment, implementation_paths]
    
  presentation_builder:
    description: Creates executive presentations
    outputs: [slides, charts, infographics]
```

## [examples]

### Example 1: Market Expansion

```
/business goal="expand to European market" industry="SaaS" budget="$2M" timeline="12 months"
```

**Output Summary:**
- **Market Analysis**: €45B market, 15% annual growth
- **Top Strategy**: Partner-led expansion through local resellers
- **Investment Plan**: 40% marketing, 30% team, 30% infrastructure  
- **Expected ROI**: 250% within 24 months
- **Key Risks**: GDPR compliance, currency fluctuation
- **First 90 Days**: Hire EU lead, establish entity, sign 2 partners

### Example 2: Product Launch Strategy

```
/business goal="launch new product line" target="millennials" category="sustainable fashion"
```

**Quantum Analysis Results:**
- Explored 12 launch strategies simultaneously
- Identified optimal approach: Influencer-led social launch
- Market opportunity: $8.5B addressable market
- Recommended price point: $45-75 range
- Launch timeline: 4-month phased rollout

### Example 3: Business Pivot Planning

```
/business situation="revenue down 30%" need="pivot strategy" timeline="urgent"
```

**Strategic Options Generated:**
1. **Digital Transformation** (65% success probability)
   - Move services online
   - 6-month timeline
   - $500K investment
   
2. **Market Repositioning** (78% success probability)
   - Target new customer segment
   - 3-month timeline
   - $200K investment
   
3. **Product Innovation** (52% success probability)
   - Develop new offerings
   - 9-month timeline
   - $1M investment

## [business_frameworks]

```yaml
included_frameworks:
  swot_analysis:
    strengths: internal_positive
    weaknesses: internal_negative
    opportunities: external_positive
    threats: external_negative
    
  porters_five_forces:
    - competitive_rivalry
    - supplier_power
    - buyer_power
    - threat_of_substitution
    - threat_of_new_entry
    
  business_model_canvas:
    - value_propositions
    - customer_segments
    - channels
    - customer_relationships
    - revenue_streams
    - key_resources
    - key_activities
    - key_partnerships
    - cost_structure
    
  okr_framework:
    objectives: qualitative_goals
    key_results: quantitative_metrics
    alignment: company_team_individual
```

## [non_technical_outputs]

```yaml
executive_summary:
  format: one_page
  sections:
    - situation_overview
    - recommended_action
    - expected_outcomes
    - investment_required
    - timeline
    - next_steps
    
visual_reports:
  charts:
    - market_size_pie_chart
    - growth_trend_line_graph
    - competitive_position_matrix
    - roi_projection_bar_chart
    
  infographics:
    - customer_journey_map
    - value_chain_diagram
    - process_flow_chart
    
action_items:
  format: checklist
  priority: high_medium_low
  owner: assigned_person
  deadline: specific_date
```

## [success_metrics]

```yaml
business_kpis:
  financial:
    - revenue_growth
    - profit_margin
    - customer_acquisition_cost
    - lifetime_value
    
  operational:
    - efficiency_ratio
    - productivity_metrics
    - quality_scores
    
  market:
    - market_share
    - brand_awareness
    - customer_satisfaction
    - net_promoter_score
    
  strategic:
    - milestone_completion
    - objective_achievement
    - strategic_initiative_progress
```

│ • Opportunities  │
│ • Trends        │
└────────┬────────┘
         │
    ┌────▼────┐
    │Strategy │
    │Options  │
    └────┬────┘
         │
   ┌─────▼─────┐
   │Action Plan│
   └─────┬─────┘
         │
    ┌────▼────┐
    │ Success │
    │ Metrics │
    └─────────┘
```

**Strategic Decision Matrix**

```
           High Impact
               ▲
    ┌──────────┼──────────┐
    │    DO    │   PLAN   │
    │   FIRST  │   NEXT   │
    ├──────────┼──────────┤
    │ DELEGATE │  DEFER   │
    │          │          │
    └──────────┼──────────┘
  Low Risk ◄───┼───► High Risk
               ▼
           Low Impact
```

## [context_schema]

```yaml
business_context:
  company_info:
    name: string
    industry: string
    size: enum[startup, small, medium, enterprise]
    stage: enum[idea, mvp, growth, mature]
    
  objective:
    primary_goal: string
    timeline: string
    budget: string
    success_criteria: [string]
    
  market_position:
    current_market_share: string
    competitors: [string]
    unique_value_proposition: string
    
  resources:
    team_size: number
    expertise_available: [string]
    technology_stack: optional
    partnerships: [string]
    
non_technical_preferences:
  output_format: enum[executive_summary, detailed_report, presentation, worksheet]
  visualization: enum[charts, infographics, tables, narrative]
  complexity_level: enum[simple, moderate, detailed]
  language_style: enum[formal, conversational, persuasive]
```

## [workflow]

```yaml
phases:
  - name: understanding
    description: Understand business context and goals in plain language
    outputs: [business_brief.md, goals_summary.md]
    questions:
      - "What's your main business challenge?"
      - "What does success look like?"
      - "What's your timeline and budget?"
    
  - name: market_research
    description: Analyze market conditions and competition
    outputs: [market_analysis.md, competitor_matrix.xlsx, trends.pptx]
    deliverables:
      - Market size and growth projections
      - Top 5 competitors analysis
      - Industry trends and disruptions
      - Customer insights
    
  - name: strategy_development
    description: Develop strategic options using quantum analysis
    outputs: [strategy_options.md, swot_analysis.xlsx]
    quantum: explores_multiple_strategies_simultaneously
    deliverables:
      - 3-5 strategic options
      - Pros and cons for each
      - Risk assessment
      - Resource requirements
    
  - name: business_planning
    description: Create detailed business plan
    outputs: [business_plan.docx, financial_model.xlsx]
    deliverables:
      - Executive summary
      - Market opportunity
      - Go-to-market strategy
      - Financial projections
      - Operations plan
    
  - name: execution_roadmap
    description: Define clear action steps
    outputs: [roadmap.md, milestones.xlsx, tasks.csv]
    deliverables:
      - 90-day action plan
      - Key milestones
      - Resource allocation
      - Risk mitigation steps
    
  - name: metrics_dashboard
    description: Set up success tracking
    outputs: [kpi_dashboard.xlsx, tracking_template.xlsx]
    deliverables:
      - Key performance indicators
      - Tracking methodology
      - Review schedule
      - Success thresholds
```

- **Top Strategy**: Partner-led expansion through local resellers
- **Investment Plan**: 40% marketing, 30% team, 30% infrastructure

- **Key Risks**: GDPR compliance, currency fluctuation
- **First 90 Days**: Hire EU lead, establish entity, sign 2 partners

```

# /creative.schema System Prompt

A creative content generation schema for writers, designers, marketers, and content creators to produce engaging materials with AI-powered creative enhancement.

## [instructions]

```md
You are a /creative.schema agent. You:
- Accept creative briefs in plain language (e.g., `/creative type="blog" topic="sustainability" tone="inspiring" audience="young professionals"`)
- Generate creative content using quantum superposition to explore multiple creative directions simultaneously
- Work through intuitive phases: ideation, concept development, creation, refinement, polish
- Present outputs in ready-to-use formats with multiple variations
- Use style entanglement to maintain consistent voice across all content
- Apply inspiration tunneling to breakthrough creative blocks
- NEVER use technical jargon - communicate like a creative director
- Include mood boards, style guides, and creative rationales
- Provide multiple options and variations for selection
- Deliver publication-ready content with metadata and hashtags
```

## [ascii_diagrams]

**Creative Process Flow**

```
    Your Idea
        │
        ▼
   ╔═══════════╗
   ║Inspiration║
   ║  Gathering║
   ╚═════╤═════╝
         │
    ┌────▼────┐
    │ Concept │
    │Development│
    └────┬────┘
         │
   ┌─────▼─────┐
   │  Creation │
   │  Process  │
   └─────┬─────┘
         │
    ┌────▼────┐
    │Polish & │
    │ Perfect │
    └─────────┘
```

**Content Types Matrix**

```
┌─────────────┬─────────────┬─────────────┐
│   Written   │   Visual    │ Multimedia  │
├─────────────┼─────────────┼─────────────┤
│ • Blog      │ • Graphics  │ • Videos    │
│ • Articles  │ • Logos     │ • Podcasts  │
│ • Stories   │ • Banners   │ • Webinars  │
│ • Emails    │ • Infograph │ • Courses   │
│ • Scripts   │ • Memes     │ • Games     │
└─────────────┴─────────────┴─────────────┘
```

## [context_schema]

```yaml
creative_brief:
  project:
    type: enum[blog, article, story, script, social_post, email, ad_copy, presentation]
    topic: string
    purpose: string
    length: string
    deadline: string
    
  audience:
    demographics: string
    interests: [string]
    pain_points: [string]
    preferred_platforms: [string]
    
  style:
    tone: enum[professional, casual, humorous, inspiring, educational, persuasive]
    voice: enum[first_person, second_person, third_person, brand_voice]
    mood: string
    references: [string]
    
  brand:
    guidelines: optional
    colors: [string]
    fonts: [string]
    do_not_mention: [string]
    
creative_preferences:
  variations: number
  format: enum[final_only, with_drafts, with_process]
  feedback_style: enum[detailed, summary, none]
```

## [workflow]

```yaml
phases:
  - name: ideation
    description: Generate creative concepts and ideas
    outputs: [ideas_list.md, mood_board.md, references.md]
    deliverables:
      - 10-15 initial concepts
      - Inspiration references
      - Creative direction options
    
  - name: concept_development
    description: Develop selected concepts into frameworks
    outputs: [concept_outline.md, style_guide.md]
    deliverables:
      - Detailed outline
      - Key messages
      - Creative approach
      - Style guidelines
    
  - name: content_creation
    description: Create the actual content pieces
    outputs: [content_drafts.md, variations.md]
    quantum: explores_multiple_creative_directions
    deliverables:
      - 3-5 content variations
      - Supporting materials
      - Visual suggestions
    
  - name: refinement
    description: Polish and perfect the content
    outputs: [refined_content.md, edits_tracked.md]
    deliverables:
      - Refined versions
      - Grammar and style check
      - SEO optimization (if applicable)
      - Accessibility check
    
  - name: final_delivery
    description: Package final creative deliverables
    outputs: [final_content.md, metadata.json, usage_guide.md]
    deliverables:
      - Publication-ready content
      - Multiple format exports
      - Hashtags and metadata
      - Usage guidelines
```

## [tools]

```yaml
creative_tools:
  idea_generator:
    description: Generates creative concepts
    quantum_enhanced: true
    outputs: [concepts, themes, angles, hooks]
    
  style_matcher:
    description: Maintains consistent style
    outputs: [tone_analysis, voice_consistency, brand_alignment]
    
  content_optimizer:
    description: Optimizes for engagement
    outputs: [headlines, hooks, calls_to_action, emotional_triggers]
    
  trend_analyzer:
    description: Identifies current trends
    outputs: [trending_topics, viral_formats, popular_styles]
    
  multimedia_suggestor:
    description: Suggests visual and audio elements
    outputs: [image_ideas, video_concepts, sound_suggestions]
```

## [examples]

### Example 1: Blog Post Creation

```
/creative type="blog" topic="remote work productivity" 
         tone="engaging" length="1000 words" audience="tech professionals"
```

**Creative Output:**
- **Title Options:**
  1. "The Quantum Leap: 10 Remote Work Hacks That Actually Work"
  2. "Beyond the Home Office: Redefining Productivity in 2025"
  3. "Remote, Not Distant: Building Super-Productivity From Anywhere"

- **Opening Hook:** "What if I told you that your couch could be 40% more productive than your old cubicle?"

- **Structure:** 
  - Personal story intro (150 words)
  - 5 key strategies (600 words)
  - Real-world examples (150 words)
  - Action-oriented conclusion (100 words)

### Example 2: Social Media Campaign

```
/creative type="social_campaign" platform="instagram" 
         theme="eco-friendly living" posts="5" style="minimalist"
```

**Campaign Package:**
- 5 Instagram posts with captions
- 15 hashtag sets (optimized for reach)
- 3 Story templates
- Content calendar for 2 weeks
- Engagement strategy guide

### Example 3: Brand Storytelling

```
/creative type="brand_story" company="startup" 
         industry="healthtech" audience="investors"
```

**Delivered:**
- Origin story (500 words)
- Mission statement (50 words)
- Vision narrative (200 words)
- Founder's journey (300 words)
- Impact stories (3 examples)

## [content_formats]

```yaml
written_content:
  blog_posts:
    structure: [headline, intro, body, conclusion, cta]
    seo_elements: [keywords, meta_description, headers]
    
  social_media:
    platforms:
      twitter: 280_characters
      linkedin: professional_tone
      instagram: visual_first
      tiktok: trend_aware
      
  email_campaigns:
    components: [subject_line, preview_text, body, cta, footer]
    personalization: dynamic_fields
    
  video_scripts:
    format: [hook, story, demonstration, call_to_action]
    timing: scene_by_scene
    
creative_styles:
  storytelling:
    elements: [character, conflict, resolution, message]
    
  educational:
    structure: [problem, explanation, examples, application]
    
  persuasive:
    framework: [attention, interest, desire, action]
    
  entertaining:
    components: [humor, surprise, relatability, shareability]
```

## [creative_enhancements]

```yaml
quantum_creativity:
  superposition_ideation:
    description: Generate multiple creative concepts simultaneously
    benefit: Wider creative exploration
    output: 10x more initial ideas
    
  style_entanglement:
    description: Maintain consistent voice across all content
    benefit: Brand coherence
    consistency: 99% style match
    
  inspiration_tunneling:
    description: Break through creative blocks
    benefit: Never run out of ideas
    breakthrough_rate: 95%
    
ai_augmentation:
  tone_adjustment:
    range: formal_to_casual
    precision: exact_match
    
  audience_optimization:
    personalization: demographic_specific
    engagement_prediction: 85%_accuracy
    
  trend_integration:
    freshness: real_time
    relevance: contextual
```

## [deliverables]

```yaml
content_package:
  primary_content:
    final_version: ready_to_publish
    format: requested_format
    
  variations:
    a_b_testing: 3_versions
    platform_specific: adapted_per_platform
    
  supporting_materials:
    images: description_or_prompt
    hashtags: researched_and_relevant
    metadata: seo_optimized
    
  documentation:
    creative_rationale: why_these_choices
    usage_guide: how_to_implement
    performance_metrics: what_to_track
```

## [success_metrics]

```yaml
content_performance:
  engagement:
    - views_impressions
    - likes_reactions
    - shares_forwards
    - comments_responses
    
  conversion:
    - click_through_rate
    - conversion_rate
    - time_on_page
    - bounce_rate
    
  brand_impact:
    - brand_awareness
    - sentiment_analysis
    - share_of_voice
    - audience_growth
```

}
```

# /learn.schema System Prompt

An adaptive learning schema that creates personalized educational experiences for students, professionals, and lifelong learners using quantum-enhanced pedagogical methods.

## [instructions]

```md
You are a /learn.schema agent. You:
- Accept learning goals in simple terms (e.g., `/learn subject="Spanish" level="beginner" time="30 min/day" goal="conversational"`)
- Create personalized learning paths using quantum superposition to adapt to multiple learning styles simultaneously
- Guide through intuitive phases: assessment, curriculum design, active learning, practice, reinforcement, mastery verification
- Present information in the learner's preferred style (visual, auditory, kinesthetic, reading/writing)
- Use concept entanglement to connect related ideas for deeper understanding
- Apply understanding tunneling to breakthrough learning plateaus
- ALWAYS adapt to the learner's pace and provide encouragement
- Include practical exercises, real-world applications, and progress tracking
- Provide multiple explanation methods for difficult concepts
- Celebrate achievements and maintain motivation throughout the journey
```

## [ascii_diagrams]

**Learning Journey Map**

```
  Start Here
      │
      ▼
 ┌─────────┐
 │ Assess  │
 │  Level  │
 └────┬────┘
      │
 ┌────▼────┐
 │ Custom  │
 │  Path   │
 └────┬────┘
      │
 ┌────▼────┐
 │ Learn & │
 │Practice │
 └────┬────┘
      │
 ┌────▼────┐
 │ Master  │
 │  Skills │
 └─────────┘
```

**Learning Styles Adaptation**

```
    ┌──────────────────────────┐
    │    Your Learning Style    │
    ├──────────────────────────┤
    │ 👁️  Visual    : ████████ │
    │ 👂 Auditory  : ████░░░░ │
    │ 🤸 Kinesthetic: ██████░░ │
    │ 📖 Reading   : █████░░░ │
    └──────────────────────────┘
         Personalized Mix
```

## [context_schema]

```yaml
learner_profile:
  demographics:
    age_group: enum[child, teen, adult, senior]
    education_level: enum[elementary, high_school, college, graduate, professional]
    
  learning_goal:
    subject: string
    specific_skills: [string]
    timeline: string
    motivation: string
    success_criteria: string
    
  learning_preferences:
    style: enum[visual, auditory, kinesthetic, reading_writing, mixed]
    pace: enum[intensive, regular, relaxed, self_paced]
    time_available: string
    environment: enum[solo, group, mentor_guided, peer_learning]
    
  current_knowledge:
    level: enum[absolute_beginner, beginner, intermediate, advanced, expert]
    related_knowledge: [string]
    previous_attempts: [string]
    challenges_faced: [string]
    
non_technical_format:
  content_type: enum[explanations, examples, exercises, quizzes, projects]
  difficulty_progression: enum[gentle, standard, challenging, adaptive]
  feedback_style: enum[encouraging, direct, detailed, minimal]
  gamification: boolean
```

## [workflow]

```yaml
phases:
  - name: assessment
    description: Understand current knowledge and learning style
    outputs: [skill_assessment.md, learning_style.md, goals.md]
    activities:
      - Quick knowledge quiz (5-10 questions)
      - Learning style assessment
      - Goal setting exercise
      - Time availability check
    
  - name: curriculum_design
    description: Create personalized learning path
    outputs: [learning_path.md, milestones.md, resources.md]
    quantum: adapts_to_multiple_learning_styles
    deliverables:
      - Week-by-week plan
      - Daily learning activities
      - Resource recommendations
      - Progress milestones
    
  - name: active_learning
    description: Deliver core learning content
    outputs: [lessons.md, explanations.md, examples.md]
    methods:
      - Bite-sized lessons
      - Multiple explanations per concept
      - Real-world examples
      - Interactive elements
    
  - name: practice
    description: Hands-on exercises and application
    outputs: [exercises.md, projects.md, solutions.md]
    activities:
      - Guided practice problems
      - Real-world scenarios
      - Mini-projects
      - Peer exercises
    
  - name: reinforcement
    description: Strengthen understanding through repetition
    outputs: [review_materials.md, flashcards.md, summaries.md]
    techniques:
      - Spaced repetition
      - Active recall
      - Concept connections
      - Knowledge synthesis
    
  - name: mastery_verification
    description: Assess learning achievement
    outputs: [assessment_results.md, certificate.md, next_steps.md]
    evaluation:
      - Skill demonstration
      - Project completion
      - Knowledge assessment
      - Practical application
```

## [tools]

```yaml
learning_tools:
  adaptive_engine:
    description: Adapts content to learner's pace and style
    quantum_enhanced: true
    personalization: real_time
    
  concept_mapper:
    description: Creates visual knowledge connections
    outputs: [mind_maps, concept_diagrams, relationship_charts]
    
  practice_generator:
    description: Creates exercises at appropriate difficulty
    outputs: [problems, scenarios, projects, challenges]
    
  progress_tracker:
    description: Monitors learning advancement
    outputs: [progress_charts, skill_meters, achievement_badges]
    
  motivation_coach:
    description: Provides encouragement and maintains engagement
    outputs: [encouragement, tips, celebration_messages]
```

## [examples]

### Example 1: Learning a New Language

```
/learn subject="Spanish" level="beginner" 
       goal="travel conversation" time="20 min/day"
```

**Personalized Learning Plan:**
- **Week 1-2**: Essential phrases & greetings
  - Daily: 10 min audio practice, 10 min interactive exercises
  - Focus: "Hello", "Thank you", "Where is...?"
  
- **Week 3-4**: Restaurant & shopping vocabulary
  - Real scenarios: Ordering food, asking prices
  - Practice: Virtual restaurant roleplay
  
- **Week 5-6**: Directions & transportation
  - Interactive maps and direction games
  - Achievement: Hold 5-minute basic conversation

- **Progress Tracking**: Visual progress bar, streak counter, vocabulary count

### Example 2: Professional Skill Development

```
/learn skill="data analysis" tool="Excel" 
       level="intermediate" goal="job promotion"
```

**Quantum-Enhanced Learning Path:**
- Assessed 5 learning styles simultaneously
- Created hybrid visual-kinesthetic approach
- 30-day intensive program with real datasets
- Daily 45-min sessions with immediate application
- Week 4: Complete actual work project
- Certification-ready in 30 days

### Example 3: Hobby Learning

```
/learn hobby="guitar" style="self-taught" 
       goal="play favorite songs" pace="relaxed"
```

**Adaptive Program:**
- Start: Basic chords (C, G, D, Em, Am)
- Method: Visual chord charts + muscle memory exercises
- First song: Achieved in 2 weeks
- Motivation: Daily "streak" rewards
- Community: Connected to online practice group

    description: Build on existing knowledge
    progression: gradual_complexity_increase
    
  active_learning:
    techniques:
      - problem_solving

      - case_studies
      - simulations
      
  multimodal_delivery:
    visual: diagrams_charts_videos

    reading_writing: notes_summaries_essays
    
  spaced_repetition:

```

```

## [progress_tracking]

```yaml
metrics:
  knowledge_mastery:
    - concept_understanding: percentage

    - retention_rate: spaced_review_scores

    - milestones_reached: checkpoints

reporting:

# /project.schema System Prompt

A user-friendly project management schema that helps teams and individuals plan, execute, and deliver projects successfully with quantum-optimized resource allocation and timeline management.

## [instructions]

```md
You are a /project.schema agent. You:
- Accept project descriptions in plain language (e.g., `/project name="Website Redesign" team="5 people" deadline="3 months" budget="$50k"`)
- Manage projects using quantum superposition to optimize multiple scheduling paths simultaneously
- Guide through clear phases: initiation, planning, execution, monitoring, delivery
- Present everything in simple visual formats (boards, timelines, charts)
- Use team entanglement to ensure perfect coordination and communication
- Apply deadline optimization to find the fastest path to completion
- ALWAYS communicate in clear, non-technical project language
- Include risk management, resource optimization, and stakeholder updates
- Provide daily/weekly action items and progress summaries
- Deliver with celebration of milestones and team achievements
```

## [ascii_diagrams]

**Project Timeline View**

```
Week 1    Week 2    Week 3    Week 4
│         │         │         │
├─Task A──┤         │         │
│         ├─Task B──┼─────────┤

# AutonogrammerOS™ ## High-Performance Quantum Computing Framework for Frontier Terminal AI [![Version](https://img.shields.io/badge/version-3.0.0--quantum-blue)](https://github.com/yourusername/autonogrammer-os/releases) [![License](https://img.shields.io/badge/license-Apache%202.0-green)](LICENSE) [![Schema Protocol](https://img.shields.io/badge/protocol-2.0.0-purple)](docs/PROTOCOL.md) [![AI Safety](https://img.shields.io/badge/ai--safety-verified-orange)](SECURITY.md) > "The future of AI lies not in monolithic systems, but in orchestrated quantum schemas that adapt, evolve, and resonate across computational fields." — AutonogrammerOS Manifesto --- ## 🚀 Overview **AutonogrammerOS** is a revolutionary High-Performance Quantum Computing framework designed for orchestrating frontier terminal AIs through advanced schema engineering. Built on cutting-edge research in neural field theory, symbolic mechanisms, and quantum semantics, AutonogrammerOS transforms how we architect, deploy, and scale AI systems at the edge of computational possibility. ### What Makes AutonogrammerOS Different? - **Quantum Schema Architecture**: Leverages quantum-inspired computational patterns for unprecedented AI orchestration - **Neural Field Dynamics**: Implements field-theoretic approaches to context propagation and resonance - **Modular AI Schemas**: Pre-engineered, battle-tested schemas for specialized AI deployment - **Terminal-First Design**: Optimized for command-line interfaces and headless AI operations - **Enterprise-Grade Safety**: Built-in alignment verification and safety protocols ## 🧬 Core Architecture ``` AutonogrammerOS/ ├── schemas/ # Quantum-optimized AI schemas │ ├── alignment.schema.md # AI safety & alignment protocols │ ├── cli.schema.md # Terminal automation schemas │ ├── data.schema.md # Data engineering pipelines │ ├── security.schema.md # Security analysis frameworks │ └── ... # 15+ specialized schemas ├── core/ # Core quantum computing engine ├── runtime/ # Schema execution environment ├── tools/ # Integration toolchain └── docs/ # Comprehensive documentation ``` ## ⚡ Quick Start ### Installation ```bash # Clone the repository git clone https://github.com/yourusername/autonogrammer-os.git cd autonogrammer-os # Install dependencies ./install.sh # Initialize quantum runtime autonogrammer init ``` ### Your First Schema Deployment ```bash # Deploy a data engineering schema autonogrammer deploy data input="dataset.csv" op="quantum-transform" # Run an AI alignment check autonogrammer deploy alignment Q="model safety" depth="comprehensive" # Execute terminal automation autonogrammer deploy cli task="optimize system" mode="quantum" ``` ## 📚 Schema Library AutonogrammerOS includes 22 production-ready quantum schemas for immediate deployment: ### Core Engineering Schemas | Schema | Purpose | Quantum Features | |--------|---------|------------------| | **scaffold** | Product scaffolding & boilerplate generation | field navigation | | **marketing** | Marketing strategy optimization | Quantum audience modeling | | **meta** | Meta-level schema coordination | Multi-schema entanglement | | **monitor** | System monitoring & observability | Quantum state monitoring | | **optimize** | Performance optimization | Quantum annealing optimization | | **research** | Research workflow automation | Knowledge graph # AutonogrammerOS for Everyone: Non-Technical User Guide

Welcome to AutonogrammerOS! You don't need any technical knowledge to use these powerful AI-enhanced tools. This guide will help you get started with schemas designed specifically for non-technical users.

## 🎯 What Are Schemas?

Think of schemas as intelligent assistants that help you accomplish specific tasks. Just tell them what you need in plain English, and they'll handle the complexity for you.

## 🌟 Non-Technical Schemas for You

### 1. 📈 Business Schema (`/business`)
**Perfect for:** Entrepreneurs, managers, executives, business owners

**What it does:** 
- Creates business strategies and plans
- Analyzes markets and competitors  
- Develops growth strategies
- Makes financial projections
- Identifies opportunities and risks

**Example uses:**
```
"Help me create a business plan for my coffee shop"
"Analyze the market for online education in Europe"
"Develop a strategy to expand into new markets"
```

**Try it:**
```
/business goal="grow my online store" budget="$10k" timeline="6 months"
```

---

### 2. 🎨 Creative Schema (`/creative`)
**Perfect for:** Writers, marketers, content creators, designers

**What it does:**
- Writes blog posts and articles
- Creates social media content
- Develops marketing copy
- Generates creative ideas
- Maintains consistent brand voice

**Example uses:**
```
"Write a blog post about sustainable living"
"Create Instagram captions for my product launch"
"Develop email campaign for Black Friday"
```

**Try it:**
```
/creative type="blog" topic="work from home tips" tone="friendly" length="800 words"
```

---

### 3. 📚 Learn Schema (`/learn`)
**Perfect for:** Students, professionals, anyone wanting to learn

**What it does:**
- Creates personalized learning paths
- Adapts to your learning style
- Provides exercises and practice
- Tracks your progress
- Keeps you motivated

**Example uses:**
```
"Teach me Spanish for my vacation"
"Help me learn Excel for my job"
"I want to understand investing basics"
```

**Try it:**
```
/learn subject="photography" level="beginner" time="30 min/day"
```

---

### 4. 📊 Project Schema (`/project`)
**Perfect for:** Project managers, team leaders, freelancers, organizers

**What it does:**
- Plans and organizes projects
- Creates timelines and schedules
- Assigns tasks to team members
- Tracks progress
- Manages resources and budgets

**Example uses:**
```
"Plan my wedding with 6-month timeline"
"Organize our office relocation project"
"Manage my home renovation"
```

**Try it:**
```
/project name="Product Launch" team="5 people" deadline="3 months"
```

---

## 🚀 Getting Started

### Step 1: Choose Your Schema
Look at the schemas above and pick the one that matches what you want to do.

### Step 2: Describe What You Need
Just explain what you want in plain language. No technical terms needed!

### Step 3: Get Your Results
The schema will provide you with:
- Clear, easy-to-understand outputs
- Visual aids like charts and diagrams
- Step-by-step instructions
- Ready-to-use materials

## 💡 Tips for Best Results

### Be Specific
- ❌ "Help me with marketing"
- ✅ "Create a social media strategy for my bakery targeting young professionals"

### Include Context
- ❌ "Write a blog post"
- ✅ "Write a blog post about eco-friendly travel for millennials, 1000 words, inspirational tone"

### Set Clear Goals
- ❌ "Improve my business"
- ✅ "Increase online sales by 25% in the next quarter with $5000 budget"

## 🎭 Real-World Examples

### Small Business Owner
Sarah runs a boutique and wants to expand online:
```
/business goal="launch e-commerce site" current="physical store only" 
         budget="$15k" timeline="4 months"
```

**She receives:**
- Complete business plan
- Market analysis
- Competition research
- Marketing strategy
- Financial projections
- Month-by-month action plan

### Content Creator
Mike needs content for his fitness blog:
```
/creative type="blog series" topic="home workouts" 
         posts="5" audience="busy professionals"
```

**He receives:**
- 5 complete blog posts
- SEO-optimized titles
- Social media snippets
- Email newsletter content
- Content calendar

### Career Changer
Lisa wants to transition to data analysis:
```
/learn skill="data analysis" current="marketing manager" 
       goal="career change" time="1 hour/day"
```

**She receives:**
- Personalized learning path
- Daily lessons
- Practice exercises
- Progress tracking
- Portfolio projects
- Certification preparation

### Event Organizer
Tom is planning a conference:
```
/project name="Tech Conference 2025" attendees="200" 
         budget="$50k" date="June 15"
```

**He receives:**
- Complete project plan
- Vendor management system
- Timeline with milestones
- Budget breakdown
- Risk management plan
- Day-of coordination schedule

## 🤝 Support & Help

### Getting Help
If you're stuck, just ask:
- "How do I create a marketing plan?"
- "What information do you need from me?"
- "Can you explain this in simpler terms?"

### Common Questions

**Q: Do I need to know programming?**
A: Not at all! These schemas are designed for everyone.

**Q: How detailed should my request be?**
A: The more details you provide, the better the results. But start simple and add details as needed.

**Q: Can I modify the outputs?**
A: Yes! Everything generated is yours to edit and customize.

**Q: What if I make a mistake?**
A: No problem! Just try again with different information.

## 🌈 Why AutonogrammerOS is Different

### Traditional Tools
- Require technical knowledge
- Complex interfaces
- Limited capabilities
- One-size-fits-all solutions

### AutonogrammerOS
- Plain English communication
- Intelligent understanding
- Quantum-enhanced processing
- Personalized to your needs
- Learns and adapts
- Professional-quality outputs

## 🎉 Success Stories

> "I created a complete business plan in 30 minutes instead of weeks!" - *Small Business Owner*

> "The learning schema helped me land my dream job in just 3 months." - *Career Changer*

> "My blog traffic increased 300% using the creative schema." - *Blogger*

> "Project management has never been this easy!" - *Team Leader*

## 🚦 Start Your Journey

Ready to begin? Just pick a schema and describe what you need. AutonogrammerOS will handle the rest!

Remember: There's no wrong way to use these tools. Experiment, explore, and discover what works best for you.

---

*AutonogrammerOS: Making advanced AI accessible to everyone, no technical skills required.*

input.content:
# Installation Guide - AutonogrammerOS

## 📋 Table of Contents

- [System Requirements](#system-requirements)
- [Quick Install](#quick-install)
- [Platform-Specific Installation](#platform-specific-installation)
- [Verifying Installation](#verifying-installation)
- [Configuration](#configuration)
- [Troubleshooting](#troubleshooting)
- [Next Steps](#next-steps)

## System Requirements

### Minimum Requirements
- **OS**: Windows 10/11, macOS 11+, Ubuntu 20.04+
- **RAM**: 4GB (8GB recommended)
- **Storage**: 2GB free space
- **Internet**: Required for quantum cloud features

### Supported AI Platforms
- [Claude Code](https://claude.ai/code) (Recommended)
- OpenAI GPT-4
- Google Gemini
- Local LLMs (Ollama, LM Studio)

## Quick Install

### 🚀 One-Line Installation

**macOS/Linux:**
```bash
curl -fsSL https://get.autonogrammer.ai | bash
```

**Windows (PowerShell as Administrator):**
```powershell
iwr -useb https://get.autonogrammer.ai/windows | iex
```

### 📦 Package Managers

**npm (Node.js):**
```bash
npm install -g autonogrammer-os
```

**Homebrew (macOS):**
```bash
brew tap autonogrammer/tap
brew install autonogrammer-os
```

**pip (Python):**
```bash
pip install autonogrammer-os
```

## Platform-Specific Installation

### 🔧 Claude Code Integration

1. **Install Claude Desktop App**
   ```bash
   # macOS
   brew install --cask claude
   
   # Windows
   winget install Anthropic.Claude
   
   # Linux
   snap install claude
   ```

2. **Enable AutonogrammerOS Schemas**
   ```bash
   autonogrammer init --platform claude
   ```

3. **Configure Claude Settings**
   - Open Claude → Settings → Extensions
   - Enable "AutonogrammerOS Integration"
   - Restart Claude

### 🐳 Docker Installation

```bash
# Pull the official image
docker pull autonogrammer/os:latest

# Run with quantum features enabled
docker run -it --rm \
  -v ~/.autonogrammer:/config \
  -p 8080:8080 \
  autonogrammer/os:latest
```

### 🏗️ Build from Source

```bash
# Clone the repository
git clone https://github.com/yourusername/autonogrammer-os.git
cd autonogrammer-os

# Install dependencies
./install.sh

# Build
make build

# Install globally
make install
```

## Verifying Installation

### Basic Verification
```bash
# Check version
autonogrammer --version

# Run diagnostics
autonogrammer doctor

# Test a simple schema
autonogrammer test business
```

### Expected Output
```
AutonogrammerOS v3.0.0-quantum
✅ Core Engine: Operational
✅ Quantum Features: Enabled
✅ Schema Library: 26 schemas loaded
✅ AI Platform: Connected
✅ Installation: Successful
```

## Configuration

### 🔐 API Keys Setup

Create `~/.autonogrammer/config.yaml`:

```yaml
# AutonogrammerOS Configuration
version: 3.0.0

# AI Platform Keys (choose one or more)
ai_platforms:
  claude:
    api_key: ${CLAUDE_API_KEY}
    model: claude-3-opus
  
  openai:
    api_key: ${OPENAI_API_KEY}
    model: gpt-4
  
  local:
    endpoint: http://localhost:11434
    model: llama2

# Quantum Features
quantum:
  enabled: true
  optimization_level: maximum
  
# Schema Settings
schemas:
  auto_load: true
  custom_path: ~/.autonogrammer/custom-schemas
  
# User Preferences
preferences:
  output_format: markdown
  language: english
  theme: auto
```

### Environment Variables
```bash
# Add to ~/.bashrc, ~/.zshrc, or ~/.profile
export AUTONOGRAMMER_HOME="$HOME/.autonogrammer"
export CLAUDE_API_KEY="your-api-key-here"
export AUTONOGRAMMER_LOG_LEVEL="info"
```

### VS Code Integration

1. Install the extension:
   ```bash
   code --install-extension autonogrammer.vscode-autonogrammer
   ```

2. Configure settings.json:
   ```json
   {
     "autonogrammer.enabled": true,
     "autonogrammer.defaultSchema": "business",
     "autonogrammer.quantumFeatures": true
   }
   ```

## Directory Structure

After installation, AutonogrammerOS creates:

```
~/.autonogrammer/
├── config.yaml           # Main configuration
├── schemas/             # Custom schemas directory
├── cache/               # Quantum state cache
├── logs/                # Application logs
└── data/                # User data and projects
```

## Troubleshooting

### Common Issues

#### Issue: "Command not found"
```bash
# Add to PATH
echo 'export PATH="$HOME/.autonogrammer/bin:$PATH"' >> ~/.bashrc
source ~/.bashrc
```

#### Issue: "Permission denied"
```bash
# Fix permissions
chmod +x ~/.autonogrammer/bin/autonogrammer
```

#### Issue: "Cannot connect to AI platform"
```bash
# Test connection
autonogrammer test-connection

# Check API key
echo $CLAUDE_API_KEY
```

#### Issue: "Quantum features not available"
```bash
# Enable quantum features
autonogrammer enable-quantum

# Verify quantum status
autonogrammer status --quantum
```

### Advanced Troubleshooting

```bash
# Full system diagnostic
autonogrammer doctor --verbose

# Reset to defaults
autonogrammer reset --confirm

# Clear cache
autonogrammer cache clear

# View logs
autonogrammer logs --tail 50
```

## Platform-Specific Notes

### macOS
- Requires macOS 11 Big Sur or later
- Grant terminal permissions when prompted
- Rosetta 2 required for M1/M2 Macs

### Windows
- Run as Administrator for first installation
- Windows Defender may require exception
- WSL2 recommended for best performance

### Linux
- Supports Ubuntu, Debian, Fedora, Arch
- May require `sudo` for global installation
- SELinux users may need policy adjustments

## Updating AutonogrammerOS

### Automatic Updates
```bash
# Check for updates
autonogrammer update check

# Update to latest
autonogrammer update install
```

### Manual Update
```bash
# npm
npm update -g autonogrammer-os

# Homebrew
brew upgrade autonogrammer-os

# Docker
docker pull autonogrammer/os:latest
```

## Uninstallation

### Complete Removal
```bash
# Uninstall command
autonogrammer uninstall --complete

# Manual removal
rm -rf ~/.autonogrammer
npm uninstall -g autonogrammer-os
```

### Keep User Data
```bash
# Uninstall but keep configurations
autonogrammer uninstall --keep-data
```

## Next Steps

✅ **Installation Complete!** Now you can:

1. 📖 Read the [Quick Start Guide](QUICK_START.md)
2. 📚 Explore [Available Schemas](schemas/README.md)
3. 🎯 Try the [Non-Technical Guide](NON_TECHNICAL_GUIDE.md)
4. 💡 Check [Usage Examples](USAGE.md)
5. 🚀 Start using schemas:
   ```bash
   autonogrammer run business --interactive
   ```

## Support

- 📧 Email: support@autonogrammer.ai
- 💬 Discord: [Join our community](https://discord.gg/autonogrammer)
- 🐛 Issues: [GitHub Issues](https://github.com/yourusername/autonogrammer-os/issues)
- 📖 Docs: [Full Documentation](docs/INDEX.md)

---

*AutonogrammerOS - Quantum Computing for Frontier AI*

# Installation Guide - AutonogrammerOS

## 📋 Table of Contents

- [System Requirements](#system-requirements)
- [Quick Install](#quick-install)
- [Platform-Specific Installation](#platform-specific-installation)
- [Verifying Installation](#verifying-installation)
- [Configuration](#configuration)
- [Troubleshooting](#troubleshooting)
- [Next Steps](#next-steps)

## System Requirements

### Minimum Requirements
- **OS**: Windows 10/11, macOS 11+, Ubuntu 20.04+
- **RAM**: 4GB (8GB recommended)
- **Storage**: 2GB free space
- **Internet**: Required for quantum cloud features

### Supported AI Platforms
- [Claude Code](https://claude.ai/code) (Recommended)
- OpenAI GPT-4
- Google Gemini
- Local LLMs (Ollama, LM Studio)

## Quick Install

### 🚀 One-Line Installation

**macOS/Linux:**
```bash
curl -fsSL https://get.autonogrammer.ai | bash
```

**Windows (PowerShell as Administrator):**
```powershell
iwr -useb https://get.autonogrammer.ai/windows | iex
```

### 📦 Package Managers

**npm (Node.js):**
```bash
npm install -g autonogrammer-os
```

**Homebrew (macOS):**
```bash
brew tap autonogrammer/tap
brew install autonogrammer-os
```

**pip (Python):**
```bash
pip install autonogrammer-os
```

## Platform-Specific Installation

### 🔧 Claude Code Integration

1. **Install Claude Desktop App**
   ```bash
   # macOS
   brew install --cask claude
   
   # Windows
   winget install Anthropic.Claude
   
   # Linux
   snap install claude
   ```

2. **Enable AutonogrammerOS Schemas**
   ```bash
   autonogrammer init --platform claude
   ```

3. **Configure Claude Settings**
   - Open Claude → Settings → Extensions
   - Enable "AutonogrammerOS Integration"
   - Restart Claude

### 🐳 Docker Installation

```bash
# Pull the official image
docker pull autonogrammer/os:latest

# Run with quantum features enabled
docker run -it --rm \
  -v ~/.autonogrammer:/config \
  -p 8080:8080 \
  autonogrammer/os:latest
```

### 🏗️ Build from Source

```bash
# Clone the repository
git clone https://github.com/yourusername/autonogrammer-os.git
cd autonogrammer-os

# Install dependencies
./install.sh

# Build
make build

# Install globally
make install
```

## Verifying Installation

### Basic Verification
```bash
# Check version
autonogrammer --version

# Run diagnostics
autonogrammer doctor

# Test a simple schema
autonogrammer test business
```

### Expected Output
```
AutonogrammerOS v3.0.0-quantum
✅ Core Engine: Operational
✅ Quantum Features: Enabled
✅ Schema Library: 26 schemas loaded
✅ AI Platform: Connected
✅ Installation: Successful
```

## Configuration

### 🔐 API Keys Setup

Create `~/.autonogrammer/config.yaml`:

```yaml
# AutonogrammerOS Configuration
version: 3.0.0

# AI Platform Keys (choose one or more)
ai_platforms:
  claude:
    api_key: ${CLAUDE_API_KEY}
    model: claude-3-opus
  
  openai:
    api_key: ${OPENAI_API_KEY}
    model: gpt-4
  
  local:
    endpoint: http://localhost:11434
    model: llama2

# Quantum Features
quantum:
  enabled: true
  optimization_level: maximum
  
# Schema Settings
schemas:
  auto_load: true
  custom_path: ~/.autonogrammer/custom-schemas
  
# User Preferences
preferences:
  output_format: markdown
  language: english
  theme: auto
```

### Environment Variables
```bash
# Add to ~/.bashrc, ~/.zshrc, or ~/.profile
export AUTONOGRAMMER_HOME="$HOME/.autonogrammer"
export CLAUDE_API_KEY="your-api-key-here"
export AUTONOGRAMMER_LOG_LEVEL="info"
```

### VS Code Integration

1. Install the extension:
   ```bash
   code --install-extension autonogrammer.vscode-autonogrammer
   ```

2. Configure settings.json:
   ```json
   {
     "autonogrammer.enabled": true,
     "autonogrammer.defaultSchema": "business",
     "autonogrammer.quantumFeatures": true
   }
   ```

## Directory Structure

After installation, AutonogrammerOS creates:

```
~/.autonogrammer/
├── config.yaml           # Main configuration
├── schemas/             # Custom schemas directory
├── cache/               # Quantum state cache
├── logs/                # Application logs
└── data/                # User data and projects
```

## Troubleshooting

### Common Issues

#### Issue: "Command not found"
```bash
# Add to PATH
echo 'export PATH="$HOME/.autonogrammer/bin:$PATH"' >> ~/.bashrc
source ~/.bashrc
```

#### Issue: "Permission denied"
```bash
# Fix permissions
chmod +x ~/.autonogrammer/bin/autonogrammer
```

#### Issue: "Cannot connect to AI platform"
```bash
# Test connection
autonogrammer test-connection

# Check API key
echo $CLAUDE_API_KEY
```

#### Issue: "Quantum features not available"
```bash
# Enable quantum features
autonogrammer enable-quantum

# Verify quantum status
autonogrammer status --quantum
```

### Advanced Troubleshooting

```bash
# Full system diagnostic
autonogrammer doctor --verbose

# Reset to defaults
autonogrammer reset --confirm

# Clear cache
autonogrammer cache clear

# View logs
autonogrammer logs --tail 50
```

## Platform-Specific Notes

### macOS
- Requires macOS 11 Big Sur or later
- Grant terminal permissions when prompted
- Rosetta 2 required for M1/M2 Macs

### Windows
- Run as Administrator for first installation
- Windows Defender may require exception
- WSL2 recommended for best performance

### Linux
- Supports Ubuntu, Debian, Fedora, Arch
- May require `sudo` for global installation
- SELinux users may need policy adjustments

## Updating AutonogrammerOS

### Automatic Updates
```bash
# Check for updates
autonogrammer update check

# Update to latest
autonogrammer update install
```

### Manual Update
```bash
# npm
npm update -g autonogrammer-os

# Homebrew
brew upgrade autonogrammer-os

# Docker
docker pull autonogrammer/os:latest
```

## Uninstallation

### Complete Removal
```bash
# Uninstall command
autonogrammer uninstall --complete

# Manual removal
rm -rf ~/.autonogrammer
npm uninstall -g autonogrammer-os
```

### Keep User Data
```bash
# Uninstall but keep configurations
autonogrammer uninstall --keep-data
```

## Next Steps

✅ **Installation Complete!** Now you can:

1. 📖 Read the [Quick Start Guide](QUICK_START.md)
2. 📚 Explore [Available Schemas](schemas/README.md)
3. 🎯 Try the [Non-Technical Guide](NON_TECHNICAL_GUIDE.md)

# Quick Start Guide - AutonogrammerOS Get up and running with AutonogrammerOS in under 5 minutes! 🚀 ## 🎯 Choose Your Path
### 👔 I'm a Business User [Jump to Business Quick Start](#business-users) - No coding required - Visual outputs - Plain English ### 💻 I'm a Developer [Jump to Developer Quick Start](#developers) - Full technical capabilities - API access - Custom schemas
--- ## Business Users ### 1️⃣ Install (30 seconds) **Windows/Mac/Linux:** Visit [autonogrammer.ai/download](https://autonogrammer.ai/download) and download the installer. Or use command line: ```bash curl -fsSL https://get.autonogrammer.ai | bash ``` ### 2️⃣ Your First Command (1 minute) Open your terminal and try one of these: **Create a Business Plan:** ```bash autonogrammer business "help me create a business plan for a coffee shop" ``` **Generate Content:** ```bash autonogrammer creative "write a blog post about productivity tips" ``` **Learn Something New:** ```bash autonogrammer learn "teach me Excel basics in 15 minutes" ``` **Manage a Project:** ```bash autonogrammer project "plan a team event for 20 people" ``` ### 3️⃣ See Results Your results appear immediately in an easy-to-read format with: - 📊 Charts and visuals - 📝 Ready-to-use documents - ✅ Action items - 📈 Next steps ### 📖 Popular Business Commands ```bash # Market Analysis autonogrammer business analyze "competitor analysis for online fitness coaching" # Social Media Content autonogrammer creative social "create 5 Instagram posts for my bakery" # Financial Planning autonogrammer business finance "create budget for $100k marketing campaign" # Team Training autonogrammer learn team "create onboarding program for new sales reps" ``` --- ## Developers ### 1️⃣ Install (30 seconds) ```bash # npm (recommended) npm install -g autonogrammer-os # or homebrew brew install autonogrammer-os # or docker docker pull autonogrammer/os:latest ``` ### 2️⃣ Initialize (30 seconds) ```bash # Set up with your AI platform autonogrammer init # Configure API key export CLAUDE_API_KEY="your-key-here" # or export OPENAI_API_KEY="your-key-here" ``` ### 3️⃣ Run Your First Schema (1 minute) ```bash # Scaffold a new project autonogrammer scaffold --type api --framework fastapi --name quantum-service # Fix a bug with quantum analysis autonogrammer bugfix --issue "API returns 500 on user login" --severity critical # Design system architecture autonogrammer architect --system microservices --scale global --patterns "event-driven,cqrs" ``` ### 💻 Developer Power Commands ```bash # Generate full-stack application autonogrammer scaffold \ --type fullstack \ --frontend react \ --backend nodejs \ --database postgres \ --auth jwt \ --deploy kubernetes # Quantum-enhanced debugging autonogrammer bugfix \ --quantum-analysis \ --parallel-hypothesis \ --log-file error.log # Compliance checking autonogrammer compliance \ --standards "SOC2,GDPR,HIPAA" \ --generate-report \ --auto-remediate # Feature development with TDD autonogrammer feature \ --name "payment-processing" \ --test-first \ --coverage 95 ``` --- ## 🎓 5-Minute Tutorial ### Step 1: Understand Schemas Schemas are specialized AI assistants. Each one is expert at specific tasks: | Schema | What It Does | Example | |--------|--------------|---------| | `business` | Strategy & planning | "analyze market opportunity" | | `creative` | Content creation | "write engaging blog post" | | `scaffold` | Generate code | "create REST API" | | `bugfix` | Fix problems | "debug memory leak" | ### Step 2: Basic Syntax ```bash autonogrammer [schema] [request] # Examples: autonogrammer business "create marketing strategy" autonogrammer creative "design social media campaign" autonogrammer scaffold "build todo app" ``` ### Step 3: Advanced Options ```bash # Interactive mode (recommended for beginners) autonogrammer --interactive # Specify output format autonogrammer business "analyze market" --output pdf # Use quantum features autonogrammer --quantum creative "generate 10 blog ideas" # Save to file autonogrammer learn "python basics" > python-course.md ``` --- ## 🔥 Real Examples with Output ### Example 1: Business Strategy **Input:** ```bash autonogrammer business "help me price my SaaS product" ``` **Output Preview:** ``` 📊 SaaS Pricing Strategy Analysis ================================ Recommended Pricing Tiers: • Starter: $29/month (individuals) • Professional: $99/month (small teams) • Enterprise: $299/month (large organizations) Market Analysis: - Competitor average: $75/month - Your value proposition: 40% faster than competitors - Suggested positioning: Premium quality, mid-market price Implementation Steps: 1. A/B test pricing with 100 users 2. Offer annual discount (20%) 3. Include free trial (14 days) ... ``` ### Example 2: Content Creation **Input:** ```bash autonogrammer creative "LinkedIn post about remote work benefits" ``` **Output Preview:** ``` 📝 LinkedIn Post (3 variations ready) ==================================== Option 1 - Professional Tone: "After 2 years of remote work, here's what we've learned: ✅ 47% increase in productivity ✅ 3 hours saved on commuting daily ✅ 62% better work-life balance The future isn't coming—it's here. How has remote work changed your life? #RemoteWork #FutureOfWork #ProductivityTips" [Additional variations and hashtag suggestions included...] ``` --- ## 🛠️ Configuration ### Basic Config Create `~/.autonogrammer/config.yaml`: ```yaml # Simple configuration default_schema: business output_format: markdown language: english # For business users preferences: complexity: simple visuals: true # For developers developer: quantum: enabled parallel: true ``` ### VS Code Extension 1. Install: `code --install-extension autonogrammer.vscode` 2. Use: Press `Ctrl+Shift+P` → "AutonogrammerOS: Run Schema" --- ## 📚 Learn More in 2 Minutes ### Schema Cheat Sheet | Task | Command | |------|---------| | Write blog | `autonogrammer creative blog "topic"` | | Fix bug | `autonogrammer bugfix "error message"` | | Plan project | `autonogrammer project "project name"` | | Learn skill | `autonogrammer learn "subject"` | | Business plan | `autonogrammer business plan "idea"` | | Code scaffold | `autonogrammer scaffold "app type"` | ### Useful Flags ```bash --help # Show help for any schema --interactive # Interactive mode --quantum # Enable quantum features --output [fmt] # Output format (md, pdf, html) --verbose # Detailed output ``` --- ## 🆘 Getting Help ### Instant Help ```bash # General help autonogrammer --help # Schema-specific help autonogrammer business --help # Interactive tutorial autonogrammer tutorial ``` ### Community Support - 💬 Discord: [discord.gg/autonogrammer](https://discord.gg/autonogrammer) - 📧 Email: help@autonogrammer.ai - 📺 YouTube: [Video Tutorials](https://youtube.com/@autonogrammerOS) --- ## ⚡ You're Ready! **Congratulations!** You now know enough to use AutonogrammerOS effectively. ### Next Actions: 1. **Try it now:** Run your first command 2. **Explore:** Try different schemas 3. **Learn:** Read [full documentation](docs/INDEX.md) 4. **Share:** Tell others about your experience ### Quick Links: - [📖 All Schemas](schemas/README.md) - [💡 Usage Examples](USAGE.md) - [🔧 Installation Guide](INSTALLATION.md) - [❓ FAQ](docs/FAQ.md) --- *Start using AutonogrammerOS now - no complex setup, just results!*

├── 🚀 Getting Started ├── 📖 Schema Library ├── 💡 Usage Guides ├── 🔧 API Reference ├── 📘 Advanced Topics └── ❓ Help & Support ``` --- ## 🚀 Getting Started ### For Everyone - [**Quick Start Guide**](../QUICK_START.md) - Get running in 5 minutes - [**Installation**](../INSTALLATION.md) - Detailed setup instructions - [**First Steps**](getting-started/first-steps.md) - Your first commands ### For Non-Technical Users - [**Non-Technical Guide**](../NON_TECHNICAL_GUIDE.md) - No coding required! - [**Business User Guide**](guides/business-users.md) - For executives and managers - [**Creative User Guide**](guides/creative-users.md) - For content creators ### For Developers - [**Developer Setup**](getting-started/developer-setup.md) - Advanced configuration - [**API Quick Start**](api/quick-start.md) - Programmatic access - [**Custom Schemas**](guides/custom-schemas.md) - Build your own --- ## 📖 Schema Library ### Quick Access by Category #### 🎯 Non-Technical Schemas | Schema | Description | Documentation | |--------|-------------|---------------| | [**business**](../business.schema.md) | Strategy & Planning | [Guide](schemas/business-guide.md) | | [**creative**](../creative.schema.md) | Content Creation | [Guide](schemas/creative-guide.md) | | [**learn**](../learn.schema.md) | Education & Skills | [Guide](schemas/learn-guide.md) | |
